plugins.name: Place inside!
plugins.description:
How many times have you realised that the objects you are working on are not inside the art board? How many times have you missed some elements in the art board while exporting or playing prototype?


This plugin is the solution to all these issues. It will check if there are any objects staying outside of frames and nest them inside if they are directly above the frame. The position of the object remains intact.
plugins.tagline: Nest objects lying outside of artboards inside. No more floating layers!

plugins.name: MEMO | シンプルなメモ帳
plugins.description:
このプラグインは、ファイルごとに個人用のメモを残せるシンプルなメモ帳です。


こんな時におすすめ


コメントが溢れてしまったプロジェクトで

必要なコメントだけをピックアップして残したいときに、コメントのリンクをメモして整理できます。


ページ数が多いプロジェクトで

後回しにした作業場所をすぐに見つけたいときに、その場所のリンクをメモしておけます。


他の人からまとめてリンクを共有されたとき

コメントやフレームのリンクをこのメモに貼り付けておけば、クリック一つでその場所にスムーズに移動できます。外部メモやチャットからFigma内リンクを開くと、ブラウザを経由して遅れることが多いですが、このプラグインならタイムラグなしで移動可能です。特にクライアントに画面共有しながら説明する際などに便利です。
plugins.tagline: このプラグインは、Figma 内でメモを取り、タブでメモを切り替えることができる機能を持っています。

plugins.name: Creatup: Mark creator name
plugins.description:
💫 The plugin allows you to track the creation date and creator by putting this information in the name of sections, frames, groups, components or pages.


How it works:

On startup, the plugin substitutes the actual date and the name of the plugin user who started the plugin into the names of selected layers. When the plugin is run again, the date and name are changed to current.


What's it add?

  1. Day • Month • Year
  2. Full user name
  3. Tag: UPD (Update)


This all speeds up the search for layers, use the keyboard shortcut "Command + F" / "Ctrl + /" for quick searches.


Why?

The plugin serves to organize the working environment in large teams and has an accumulative effect. If you start using it now, you will be able to track your entire design history in the future.
plugins.tagline: Mark the date and the creator's in layers, frames and sections names

plugins.name: DesignDetox
plugins.description:
Transform your Figma experience with DesignDetox – the ultimate tool for decluttering and optimizing your design workspace. Our plugin is engineered to enhance the efficiency of designers by providing a swift and seamless way to manage and organize your Figma files.


Key Features:

  • Detach Instances and Components: Simplify your designs by detaching all instances and components with just a click. Perfect for finalizing designs or preparing files for handoff.
  • Remove Auto-Layouts: Instantly strip away auto-layout properties from selected frames, allowing for more flexible manipulation and customization of your designs.
  • Eliminate Hidden Layers: Clean up your workspace by removing all hidden layers from the entire page. A great way to reduce file size and improve manageability.


DesignDetox is more than just a plugin; it's your personal assistant for maintaining a clean and efficient design environment. With its intuitive interface and powerful features, DesignDetox is an indispensable tool for every Figma user looking to enhance productivity and focus on creativity.


Easy to Use:

  • Simple, user-friendly interface with clear, actionable buttons.
  • Real-time updates on the count of instances/components, auto-layout frames, and hidden layers in your project.
  • Instant notifications provide feedback on actions taken for transparency and control.


Whether you're a seasoned designer or just starting out, DesignDetox helps you maintain a clutter-free workspace, enabling you to focus on what truly matters – creating stunning designs. Try DesignDetox today and experience a cleaner, more efficient design process in Figma!

accepted.name: Sonali Agrawal
accepted.description: Design Systems | Product Designer | Mentor | Figma Fan | UX Strategist

plugins.tagline: Streamline Your Figma Workspace

plugins.name: Stray Component & Variable Finder (Ghost, Unindexed, Orphaned, Etc.)
plugins.description:
What is this plugin good for?


This plugin makes it easy to identify ‘stray’ component or variables within a design file.


What is a ‘stray' component/variable

A stray component or variable is one that either:

(1) is no longer properly linked to its original library (because the library was removed or changed), or

(2) was left behind from a previous library you no longer want to use.


Figma often identifies these in your assets panel as libraries that are ‘used in this file’ but they does not give you any indication of WHERE in the file they are being used. This plugin makes it easy to identify these components.


𖨠𖨠𖨠 If you find this plugin useful, and you feel like it, throw me some coffee dollars. 𖨠𖨠𖨠


How do I use this plugin?


1. Identify libraries you want to keep.

Start by opening the file where you want to find and fix stray components or variables. In the Assets panel, review the libraries that are currently being used in the file.


2. Index the libraries you don't want flagged as stray.

Open the plugin inside each library file you want to keep.

In the Library Manager tab, click "Index Library" for each one.

This ensures that components and variables from these libraries won't be flagged as stray later.


3. Return to your target file and run a scan.

Go back to your target file. In the plugin, open the "Scan Components/Variables" tab and choose whether you want to scan for components or variables.

The plugin will search your file for anything not included in your indexed libraries.


4. Review the results.

You'll see a list of all stray components or variables it found, along with helpful details like node names and their location in the file.





More Specific FAQ Questions 


What is the difference between Variable View and Node View for variables?


Variable View:

Organizes the scan results by each specific stray variable.

You can see all the places across your file where a particular stray variable appears.


Node View:

Organizes the scan results by the nodes that have the most stray variables.

This helps you prioritize fixing nodes with the highest number of issues, regardless of the variable types.


The scan is identifying components that belong to one of my indexed libraries as a Stray, what’s going on?


The most likely answer is that the component was deleted from the library. When this happens the component in the target file will point to its original library but does not actually exist there any longer (and therefore was not indexed)


Why can’t the plugin identify the library the stray component/variable comes from?


The Figma Plugin API does not expose data about files you own or have access to, so there is no way to get this information without adding an Authentication flow


Why can’t the plugin display the name of each variable in the results list?


Similar to the answer above, the Plugin API cannot get the name of variables from files that it does not have access to. It can only access the local name of the variable which tends to be semantically meaningless. Sorry.


Can I scan for both components and variables at the same time?


No, you’ll need to run the scan separately for components and variables. Maybe this could come in a future update.


Do I need to re-index libraries if they change?


Yes. If you update a library (e.g. delete or rename components/variables), it's a good idea to re-open that file and click “Index Library” again to make sure your scan stays accurate.


How long does the scan take?


The indexing and scanning process should be relatively quick (~3 to 30 seconds) generally; however the processing time is related to how big of a file you are scanning.
plugins.tagline: Search find and fix unused, orphaned, or unindexed library components & variables in your file

plugins.name: Designlens
plugins.description:
DesignLens is your AI design assistant — built right inside Figma.

Get instant, actionable feedback on your designs so you can iterate faster, ship smarter, and design with confidence.


Design reviews are often slow, inconsistent, and filled with vague feedback like “make it cleaner” or “this doesn’t feel right.” You’re left guessing what to fix — or worse, waiting days just to hear back.

DesignLens fixes that. With just a click inside Figma, DesignLens analyzes your screen and gives you detailed feedback — instantly.


⚙️ How it works:

1. Select any frame in Figma

2. Run the DesignLens plugin

3. Get clear, structured feedback in seconds



🔍 What it does:


1. UI/Visual Analysis

Get insights on layout, hierarchy, accessibility, consistency, and overall clarity.

We don’t just point out issues — we tell you what’s working, what needs fixing, and how to fix it.


2. Heuristic Evaluation

Your design is evaluated against proven usability principles (like error prevention, recognition over recall, and user control) — helping you catch friction points before users do.


👀 Coming soon:

- UX flow-level analysis

- Business goal alignment


We're just getting started.


📬 Feedback or questions?

Reach us anytime at trydesignlens@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Design Feedback made Accessible

Big Bird Text Formatter plugin automatically detects Chinese and English text in selected Figma frames and applies separate typography attributes. Users can customize font, font size, font weight, letter spacing, line height, paragraph spacing, text case, and text decoration to maintain consistent styles for different languages. This plugin is perfect for users who need to manage both Chinese and English text formatting in their designs efficiently.

plugins.name: Point Ameba
plugins.description:
The numbers described by [] in STICKY and SHAPE_WITH_TEXT are extracted from the selection and totaled.

It is also possible to calculate STICKY placed in SECTION or GROUP.


Once installed, you can easily call it by typing Point Ameba in the Quick Actions


Mac: ⌘ + / or ⌘ + P

Windows: Control + / or Control + P


The following cases are supported.

- Corresponds to the preceding and following character string input

- Full-width input

- Decimal point input


[2]
[2pt]
[spike2pt]
[２]
[２pt]
[spike２pt]
[0.05]

plugins.name: Color Code Extractor
plugins.description:
Color Code Extractor helps you identify and extract all color codes used in your selected Figma frames, making it easier to maintain design consistency and build design systems.


✨ FEATURES:


• Extract all color codes from selected frames, groups, or individual nodes


• View colors in a visual grid with hex codes for easy reference


• Copy any color code to clipboard with a single click


• Handles both fill and stroke colors automatically


• Supports opacity/alpha channel in color codes


• Works with multiple selections simultaneously


🎯 PERFECT FOR:


• Design system documentation


• Creating color palettes from existing designs


• Ensuring color consistency across projects


• Handoff to developers


• Auditing designs for color usage


Simply select any frame, group, or node in your design, run the plugin, and instantly see all colors used. No more manually inspecting elements or guessing which colors are being used where!


Color Code Extractor is lightweight, fast, and works entirely within Figma - no external services required.

plugins.description:
Use AI and ChatGPT to make fake content for your designs.!


Fake Content Maker is a straight-forward Figma Plugin where you enter in your OpenAI key, and then can enter in a prompt to generate your own fake content.


👋🏻 First things first:

plugins.name: Variable Icons
plugins.description:
Convert selected SVG icons into components while assigning variables for streamlined design control.


Currently, the plugin supports only line icons using stroke color.


Benefits

  1. Centralized icon styling with variables and modes.
  2. Optimized icon components for instance swaps.
  3. Tailored for Lucide Icons.


Video Tutorial

Watch a quick demo to see the plugin in action.


Features

  1. Assigns variables to:
  2. Width and height of selected frames
  3. Stroke weight of the shapes of selected frames
  4. Stroke color of the shapes of selected frames
  5. Sets selected frames to auto-layout mode
  6. Positions the shapes of selected frames in absolute mode
  7. Converts selected frames into components
  8. Saves assigned variables as preferences within the plugin


Limitations

  1. Local Variables Only: The plugin supports only local variables. Shared library assets are not recognized, but local variables with alias values from remote libraries will work.
  2. Stroke Icons Only: Filled-style icons are not supported for stroke weight and stroke color variable assignments.
  3. Flattened Shapes Only: Icons containing ovals, rectangles, text, or groups will not have variables assigned.


Feedback

I’m a solo designer who learned coding with AI tools. This plugin has proved useful in my workflow, but I’m eager to hear how it fits into yours.

Comments and suggestions are welcome!

  1. Share your thoughts below
  2. Or email me: domas dot markevicius at me dot com
plugins.tagline: An easy way to convert SVG icons to components with variables.

plugins.name: ColorGen
plugins.description:
Colorgen – Your Ultimate Color Toolkit for Figma


This is my first plugin! Transform your Figma workflow with Colorgen, the all-in-one plugin designed for modern creators who want vibrant and versatile color solutions. Whether you’re looking to create harmonious palettes, stunning gradients, or nuanced color scales, Colorgen makes it easy. Plus, enjoy an engaging HSL color game to challenge and sharpen your color skills.


🌈 Key Features:


  1. Effortless Palette & Gradient Generation: Generate inspiring palettes and gradients with just a click.
  2. Interactive Color Application: Apply any generated color directly to your selected frames for seamless integration.
  3. Add to Canvas: Instantly add custom palettes and gradient scales to your Figma canvas for easy reference and use.
  4. HSL Color Game: Have fun and test your color-matching skills with a built-in color game.
  5. User-Friendly Design: Simple controls that enhance your creative process without complexity.


Elevate your design projects with Colorgen and make color exploration fun, intuitive, and impactful. Please provide feedback and any additional feature enhancements.


🛠️ Areas for Improvement:

  1. Color palette generations could be better. I'm working on incorporating color libraries and some generative features for more robust palettes.
  2. HSL Color game needs some improvement - the difficulty levels aren't as good as they could be
  3. Thinking about adding color palettes from images!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly craft vibrant color palettes & gradients & bring them straight into Figma—fun included.

plugins.name: Text Contrast
plugins.description:
The fastest contrast checker in the galaxy! 


Text Contrast lets you instantly run a AA or AAA contrast report on all text across your selected mockups before you can blink.


Simply select a frames, groups, or components, and hit Check.

A detailed report will automatically display next to your artboard, giving you immediate feedback on color contrast compliance.


Hot Features:

  1. The plugin quickly calculates contrast ratios between text and its background, ensuring compliance with WCAG 2.2 standards.


  1. No need to be an expert, results appear instantly as a visual copy next to the original, with a focus on contrast and font size.


  1. The plugin won’t alter your design. Results are shown as an overlay, maintaining your original layout.


  1. Select your artboard, click "CHECK", and voilà! Get immediate results without leaving your workflow. 


How It Works:

  1. Easy Interaction: Select your artboard and click "CHECK." The plugin analyzes the contrast between the text color and its parent fill color.


  1. Focused Analysis: The calculation is based on the contrast ratio and font sizes, providing fast, accurate results for single color text layers. 


Limitations:

  1. The plugin operates over frames, groups, and components but only supports one artboard at a time.


  1. It currently does not support gradients or mixed color/font size text layers.


This is my first plugin, so feel free to share any feedback ♥️
plugins.tagline: Figure out text contrast issues reported directly on the artboard.

plugins.name: Translized
plugins.description:
About Translized

Jumpstart your software localization journey right from the design phase with Translized’s Figma plugin. This tool empowers you to integrate translations directly into your UI designs within Figma. You can also upload your translation terms from Figma into Translized, streamlining your workflow and ensuring timely completion of the localization process (leveraging both human and machine translation).

Avoid common pitfalls like translations disrupting your UI layout. Provide your translators with the context they need through integrated screenshots. Explore more at translized.com.

Features:

  • Easy Translation Uploads: Transfer your translation terms from Figma straight to Translized.
  • Live UI Visualization: See your translations come to life within your Figma UI designs.
  • Contextual Clarity for Translators: Enhance translation accuracy with context-providing screen uploads.
  • Consistent Naming Conventions: Establish key names for your translation terms, bridging your copy, design, and code seamlessly.

Getting Started with Translized in Figma:

  1. Open Your Project
  2. Install the Plugin: Head over to the Plugins section and install the Translized plugin.
  3. Link Your Account: Provide your API Access Token (found under Account/API Access) to link your Translized account. If you don’t have an account yet, sign up for free at translized.com.
  4. Prepare Your Texts: In Figma, select your texts. Check and modify key names as needed, and then upload them to Translized.
  5. Select Project and Language: Finalize your upload by choosing the appropriate project and language.
  6. Upload Screenshots: (Available on the Premium plan) Ensure to check ‘Upload screenshots’ for added context in translations.
  7. Translate on Translized: Utilize machine translation, professional human translation services, or manually translate your content on the Translized platform.
  8. Pull Translations into Figma: Use the ‘Pull Translations’ tab to select your project and language. This action will create a new page in Figma with all texts translated into the selected language.

Need more guidance? Visit our comprehensive documentation page for detailed instructions.


Contact us through email: info@translized.com if you need any assistance.
plugins.tagline: Add translations from & to your design easily

plugins.name: scale_One-click adaptation to device screen
plugins.description:
This plug-in can help designers adapt their designs to devices of different sizes with one click.


1. Automatic layout adjustment:

Automatically adjust left and right and top and bottom layouts according to different size ratios

- Automatically detect horizontal or vertical layout direction

- Adjust element spacing and padding according to layout direction

- Maintain the overall structure and visual balance of the design


2. Intelligent size detection and customization:

- Analyze all design draft sizes on the current page

- Identify the most commonly used sizes and recommend them to users

- Built-in common device sizes (iPhone, iPad, Web, etc.)

- Support adding custom sizes, customizable names and sizes


3. One-click export:

After generating the manuscript, you can export all illustrations with one click and add size information to the name

- Automatically set export options, including size information

- Support batch export of all adapted design drafts

- Automatically include size information in file naming for easy management


该插件可以帮助设计师一键将设计稿适配到不同尺寸的设备上。


1. 自动调整布局：

根据不同的尺寸比例自动调整左右和上下布局

- 自动检测水平或垂直布局方向

- 根据布局方向调整元素间距和内边距

- 保持设计的整体结构和视觉平衡


2. 尺寸智能检测与自定义：

- 分析当前页面中的所有设计稿尺寸

- 识别最常用的尺寸并推荐给用户

- 内置常见设备尺寸（iPhone、iPad、Web等）

- 支持添加自定义尺寸，可自定义名称和尺寸大小


3. 一键导出：

生成稿件后可以一键导出所有配图并在命名中加入尺寸信息

- 自动设置导出选项，包含尺寸信息

- 支持批量导出所有适配后的设计稿

- 文件命名中自动包含尺寸信息，方便管理
plugins.tagline: Ability to scale designs to multiple sizes, and lock scaling rules for design elements

plugins.name: Clean layers
plugins.description:
With Clean layers, you're able to find unnamed layers, components, and stray instances (which are component instances that no longer have a parent component), helping you maintain a clean file that's properly organized and synced.

plugins.name: Peppercorn - Find Centroids (Visual Center)
plugins.description:
Find the geometric center (centroid) of vector shapes.

This experimental plugin calculates the centroid to determine the center of shapes.

👉 Usage

  1. Place your shape in a container for better experience
  2. Select the shape
  3. Run the plugin


⚠️ Note

  1. This plugin is experimental and may not work perfectly for all shapes
  2. The centroid method works best for simple and symmetrical shapes
  3. For complex or highly irregular shapes, the centroid may not always represent the visual center


🛠️ Future Updates

  1. We plan to add visual guides to help you understand the centroid's position
  2. Considering additional methods like the smallest enclosing circle for more complex shapes

plugins.name: Alignify
plugins.description:
このプラグインは、FigJamで選択したノードを整列するための便利なツールです。水平方向や垂直方向への整列だけでなく、カスタム列数でのグリッド整列もサポートしています。また、ノード間の間隔を調整することも可能です。これにより、効率的で視覚的に一貫性のあるデザインを簡単に実現できます。


主な機能

  1. 水平方向整列：選択したノードを水平方向に1列で整列します。
  2. 垂直方向整列：選択したノードを垂直方向に1列で整列します。
  3. カスタムグリッド整列：選択したノードを指定した列数でグリッド状に整列します。
  4. 間隔調整：ノード間の間隔を自由に調整できます。


使い方

  1. 整列させたいノードを選択します。
  2. プラグインのインターフェースで列数や間隔を設定します。
  3. 水平方向整列、垂直方向整列、またはステッパーをクリック、もしくはドラッグします。
  4. ノードが設定に従って整列されます。


Plugin Introduction

This plugin is a handy tool for aligning selected nodes in FigJam. It supports horizontal and vertical alignment, as well as custom grid alignment with a specified number of columns. Additionally, it allows you to adjust the spacing between nodes, making it easy to achieve efficient and visually consistent designs.


Key Features

  1. Horizontal Alignment: Aligns selected nodes in a single horizontal row.
  2. Vertical Alignment: Aligns selected nodes in a single vertical column.
  3. Custom Grid Alignment: Aligns selected nodes in a grid with the specified number of columns.
  4. Spacing Adjustment: Allows you to freely adjust the spacing between nodes.


How to Use

  1. Select the nodes you want to align.
  2. Set the number of columns and the spacing in the plugin interface.
  3. Click or drag the Horizontal Alignment, Vertical Alignment, or the stepper.
  4. The nodes will be aligned according to the settings.
plugins.tagline: Multiple nodes can be easily aligned. The number of columns and spacing can also be easily set.

plugins.name: CoverCraft - Figma x Hashnode
plugins.description:
Are you creating cover images for your Hashnode Post ? Constantly downloading, naming, renaming files and switching platforms just to ensure your cover image looks perfect. We've been there, and we understand your frustration.


But fret not, because CoverCraft is here to save the day! Say goodbye to all the hassle and frustration. With CoverCraft, certainly no more platform switching.


Imagine being able to craft your cover images in Figma and seamlessly set them on your Hashnode blog posts with just a few clicks. That's the power of CoverCraft - simplifying your workflow and allowing you to focus on what truly matters: crafting your cover.


Features:


Firstly, To Unlock the full potential of CoverCraft you need access token. Don't have a token yet? No worries – create access token


1) Set Cover Images:


  • While plugin is open, Select image or frame containing your cover image. Next, choose the post in which you want to set the selected image as the cover, currently we support published post.
  • Finally, Click Set as Cover to apply the selected image or frame as the cover for the chosen post.


2) Generate your Imagination:


  • We discovered that users often struggled with selecting the perfect background image. To address this, Introducing Lexica AI into plugin to Generate Images from Prompt. Search for Background Images based on your imagination.
  • Open plugin and run in file where you aim to build Cover Image.
  • Navigate to the Search Cover Tab, Enter your imaginative prompt to initiate the Search. Browse through the generated images and select the one that resonates with your vision.
  • Witness the magic by clicking on image and make your cover. Once your newly created cover image is ready, set without ever leaving Figma.


3) Dark and Light Mode Support:


  • Our plugin seamlessly integrates with Figma's preference theme, offering support for both dark and light modes. This means that regardless of your chosen theme in Figma, our plugin will automatically adjust its appearance to match.
  • This ensures a consistent and comfortable user experience. If preferred working theme is dark, our plugin will automatically detect and switch to dark mode. Conversely, if you opt for a light theme, the plugin will effortlessly transition to light mode.
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly Set Cover Images from Figma to Hashnode

plugins.name: Storylane: Turn Figma into AI-interactive demos
plugins.description:
From Figma screens to killer product demos - powered by AI


Convert your Figma designs into interactive product demos in just a few clicks. Storylane lets you build personalized, AI-enhanced demos directly from your Figma frames - ready for sales, marketing, and presales teams to share across channels.


How it works?

1. Download and open the Storylane plugin

Install the Storylane plugin and open it in your Figma file.

2. Choose which Figma frames to export

Select All frames or just the ones you've highlighted.

3. Pick your destination and click “Create New Demo"

Instantly export your frames to a new demo or to an existing one in Storylane.

4. Fine-tune and enhance with AI features in the Storylane editor

Add voiceovers, guides, personalization, and more — no code needed.

5. Share the interactive demo across channels and track engagement

Embed on websites, use in emails, or send in sales calls — with real-time analytics.


Benefits

  1. Gather actionable feedback before development begins
  2. Showcase the product with just mockups when pitching to investors
  3. Connect design, marketing and sales with a single source of truth


Popular features

  1. AI demo creation - Add professional voiceovers, guides, and annotations in seconds
  2. 6+ guide types - Multiple guide types available to create the perfect interactive experience
  3. Instant personalization - Personalize content to prospects without rebuilding demos
  4. AI video avatars - Choose lifelike stock avatars or your replicas to narrate your product story
  5. Multilingual capability - Create demos in 25+ languages with 63+ voice options
  6. Multi-chapter demos - Create choose-your-own-adventure experiences so buyers can explore what matters most to them
  7. Lead generation - Use native or custom lead forms to collect leads at the right moment
  8. Conversion boosters - Add always-available CTAs that significantly increases CTR rate


Deploy anywhere

  1. Embed on websites to convert visitors
  2. Attach to emails for higher engagement
  3. Create immersive offline event experiences
  4. Share as leave-behinds after sales calls
  5. Build custom demo hubs for buying committees


Join 4000+ marketing and sales teams who use Storylane to turn designs into measurable business impact.

Proof of trust - 600+ reviews and the highest satisfaction rating on G2.


First time using Storylane?

See how it works by exploring our interactive product demo or sign up for a free account to get started right away.


For personalized guidance, schedule a call with a demo expert who can show you how to maximize your results.
plugins.tagline: From Figma mockups to interactive demos for feedback, pitching, and showcasing

plugins.name: Iconsynx
plugins.description:
ICONSYNX plugin converts SVG icons into WebFonts (.woff2, .ttf, .eot) with seamless React, Vue, and TypeScript integration. Easily generate custom icon fonts, automate GitHub PR creation, and streamline your workflow. Perfect for teams managing CSS-based icon fonts while working with modern JavaScript frameworks.


Privacy Note:

To enable GitHub PR automation, this plugin requires access to your GitHub repository via a personal access token (GitHub token). The token is used only for creating pull requests and is stored securely. No sensitive data is collected or shared.


🔹 Key Features:

✅ Convert Figma SVGs to WebFonts (.woff2, .ttf, .eot)

✅ One-click WebFont generation for seamless icon management

✅ React & Vue support for easy integration in frontend projects

✅ TypeScript compatibility for strongly-typed icon components

✅ Automated GitHub PRs to update icon sets effortlessly

✅ Optimized font bundles to reduce file size and improve performance
plugins.tagline: Convert SVG icons into WebFonts with GitHub PR automation & React, Vue, TypeScript support.

plugins.name: Name Slayer
plugins.description:
Slay your layer names

  1. Select layer(s) with styles or variables directly applied to them (color, text and effect).
  2. Preview how many layers will be renamed, already match their style/variable name, have no styles applied, or if part of your selection has more than one style/variable applied to the same layer.
  3. Click Rename layer!


This plugin is a great complement to Styler, when style names and layer names become out of sync.


Notes

  1. Name Slayer supports color variables and color styles applied to either a fill or stroke, as well as text styles and effect styles.
  2. Layers with more than one style or variable can’t be renamed – layers must have a single style or variable to know what to rename it to.
  3. Styles which alias variables will be rename to the style, not the variable within.

accepted.name: Murph
accepted.description: Systems Designer • Plugin Author • Rectangle Lover

plugins.tagline: Easily rename layers to match the name of their applied styles and variables.

plugins.name: Typecetera
plugins.description:
Easily create and fine-tune custom fonts directly within Figma. Main features include:

A Glyphs library to manage all your characters, live previews to test fonts on the go, and real-time Kerning adjustments for perfect spacing. No need to export or install—just design, adjust, and Use your custom fonts instantly in your projects. Ideal for both beginners and type enthusiasts looking for a smarter, more integrated approach to typography!
plugins.tagline: Create your own fonts—effortlessly, right inside Figma.
